title: Conor McGregor ready to accept Tyson Fury's coach request for MMA bout
text:
Fury is poised to make his WWE debut (Picture: Rex Features)

Tyson Fury shocked the fight world over the weekend by claiming he could make his MMA debut next year and Conor McGregor has now responded to the Gypsy King’s request to be his coach.

McGregor is the biggest MMA star on the planet as the UFC’s biggest earner, while Fury is considered one of the best heavyweights in boxing.

Fury has no experience in MMA, but insisted it was possible he could cross over into the sport in 2020.

After Fury suggested McGregor could be his coach, the Irishman responded on Twitter, saying:’ Up the Fury’s. Let’s go’

Up the Fury’s! Let’s go 👊 https://t.co/KiauM5RPt3 — Conor McGregor (@TheNotoriousMMA) October 27, 2019

Fury is currently preparing for his debut in WWE, but appears to have one eye on MMA as well.

‘Who knows? I have got something big coming up after this, even bigger than this,’ Fury told Sky Sports.

‘We might see Tyson Fury have his MMA debut this year.

‘Tyson Fury is taking over. I have been speaking to Conor about it. He’s willing to train me. It’s gonna be good.

McGregor appears ready to train Fury (Picture: Getty)

‘He’s just said any time that you are ready come over to Dublin and let’s go. I can’t wait, I’m going to take him up on the offer.

‘Who knows we might be on a double-header. I come from a long line of bare-knuckle boxing champions.

‘Getting hurt, getting bloodied is nothing new to me, it’s all a part of my heritage. I would love to get in there and smash someone up.’

description: Conor McGregor appears to have given the greenlight to heavyweight boxer Tyson Fury's request for him to train him for his MMA debut.
